item.title: Advanced URL rewriting with Apache APISIX
item.description: I spoke at Swiss PgDay in Switzerland in late June. The talk was about how to create a no-code API with the famous PostgreSQL database, the related PostgREST, and Apache APISIX, of course. I already wrote about the idea in a previous post. However, I wanted to improve it, if only slightly. PostgREST offers a powerful SELECT mechanism. To list all entities with a column equal to a value, you need the following command: curl /products?id=eq.1 id is the columneq.1 corresponds to the WHERE cla
item.author: (Nicolas Fränkel)

item.title: Mining Pool Game Theory during Forks
item.description: I have recently been looking at mining pool behavior during forks. Which block does a pool choose to mine on during a fork? Do they behave rationally and mine on their own block? In this post, I’ll detail the mining pool game theory during forks and give some recent examples of pool behavior.

item.title: Understanding Apache Paimon's Consistency Model Part 3 — Jack Vanlightly
item.description: In this final part of this Apache Paimon series, I’ll go over the formal verification with Fizzbee. item.title: Common logical fallacies surrounding capitalism
item.description:
We live in an age of extreme abundance compared to our ancestors. This fact isn’t often reflected in Western media or online discourse. Indeed, there is a growing sentiment that ‘the system isn’t working’, ‘the system is rigged’,  and that ‘things are getting worse’.

item.title: How To Know When It's Time To Go
item.description:
I retired in 2021 at 63.5 after about four decades as a programmer. What made me do this was not failing ability in any way, but after a year of consideration, I realized I didn't care to do it anymore.
